subject: Re: [junit] Having problem with Test Suite - Will you please help me
msgSnippet: 1. Your suite class should not extend TestCase 2. The signature of the suite method should be public static Test suite() with a lower-case s . 3. Your main
messageBody:
1. Your suite class should not extend TestCase

2. The signature of the suite method should be "public static Test suite()"
with a lower-case "s".

3. Your main method should call junit.textui.TestRunner.run(suite())

----- Original Message -----
From: "balakrishnan sengodan" <bsengodan@...>
To: <junit@yahoogroups.com>
Sent: Sunday, July 20, 2003 12:17 PM
Subject: [junit] Having problem with Test Suite - Will you please help me


> Hello All:
> I have created two test classes: AccountJU and
> TestGame and tested them individually. I have created
> another suite class AllTest.class and added the above
> two classes to the suite. Unfortunately I am getting
> the following error.
> I know I am making mistakes. But i do not know how to
> figure it iut. Will any one please help me to fix
> this.
>
> Error Message:
> ==============
> .F
> Time: 0.01
> There was 1 failure:
> 1)
> warning(junit.framework.TestSuite$1)junit.framework.AssertionFailedError:
> No tests found in AllTests
> at AllTests.main(AllTests.java:9)
>
> FAILURES!!!
> Tests run: 1, Failures: 1, Errors: 0
>
>
>
> The code:
> ========
> import junit.framework.*;
>
> public class AllTest extends TestCase {
>
> public static void main(String[] args) {
> junit.textui.TestRunner.run(new
> TestSuite(AllTest.class));
> }
>
> public static Test Suite() {
> TestSuite suite = new TestSuite();
>
> suite.addTest(new TestSuite(AccountJU.class));
> suite.addTest(new TestSuite(TestGame.class));
> return suite;
> }
>
> } // End of class
>
>
